Posts.Content: May 10, 2010 04:41PM geokat wrote: I had a mass removed from my right breast last month but it was a fibroadenoma.  I have had them in the past, but this was the first one removed since it had grown in size.  The surgery was fine.....the IV hurt more than where the surgery was done.  Not sure what yours can be, but if it's a fibro, they are common and usually benign.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: getting lump removed countrymama flower123

Posts.Content: geokat wrote: I had a fibroadenoma removed a few weeks ago.  I've had small ones before that biopsies were done, and I was told they were benign and not to worry.  Yesterday I went to the surgeon as a followup and she said the biopsy on the fibroadenoma was benign but she found some atypical cells. She assured me it wasn't cancer, but referred me to an oncologist to discuss treatment, which comes with severe side effects.  And then she leaves....and I feel like someone just punched me in the stomach.  I'm 100% healthy....never a health issue.....mild anemia that I take iron supplements for.  That's it.  No hospitilizations other than a tonsilectomy when I was 8.  And no family history of any kind of cancer in my family.  None. Do atypical cells always turn into cancer?  What are the odds?  Can't I just monitor my breasts with frequent tests and avoid treatment (I have 2 small children....I'm only 39).  I'm waiting to hear from oncologist, but I want to know my odds.  I want to know if I can avoid cancer or is it inevitable.  I'm so scared............. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: biopsy done had atypical cells. geokat awb
